channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 'Segregated facilities' are no longer explicitly banned in federal contracts
item.description: The Trump administration cut a clause from federal contracting rules that had been on the books since the 1960s: Companies are no longer explicitly pr...

item.title: As Oklahoma reels from deadly wildfires, authorities warn of fresh fire threat
In the Missouri Ozarks, residents struggle to rebuild after tornadoes
item.description: Twisters that tore through Union County, Missouri killed 6 people. One couple survived against incomprehensible odds in a trailer obliterated by the s...

item.title: This is why Canada has plenty of eggs — and the U.S. doesn't
item.description: While the U.S. grapples with an egg shortage caused by avian flu, eggs remain plentiful and affordable in Canada. There are reasons for that, includin...

item.title: Scientists at Antarctic base rocked by alleged assault
item.description: A spokesperson for the South African government told the BBC there had been an assault at the station.

item.title: Israel launches deadly new strikes in Gaza as ceasefire falls apart
item.description: Officials in Hamas-ruled Gaza say the new Israeli assault has killed more than 400 people, as Israel accuses Hamas of refusing to extend the ceasefire...

item.title: Stuck astronauts Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore are finally on their way back to Earth

item.title: Detained Columbia University student disputes government’s ‘bedbugs’ claim in court papers
At 83, Martha Stewart celebrates gardening with her 101st book
item.description: Martha Stewart talks gardening, wanting to be "one of the girls" and her 101st book with NPR Morning Edition host Michel Martin.

item.title: Israel launches waves of strikes on Gaza with more than 400 reportedly killed
item.description: The Israeli military says it is targeting Hamas "terror targets", but eyewitnesses describe a nightmare scenario.

item.title: Chinese state media hails Trump's cuts to Voice of America
item.description: State newspaper gloated that the network has "now been discarded by its own government like a dirty rag".

item.title: Moment Nasa astronauts begin journey back to Earth
item.description: Two astronauts are returning home after nine months in space.

item.title: Remains of another serial killer victim found at landfill, officials say
item.description: Marcedes Myran was one of the Indigenous women slain by convicted serial killer Jeremy Skibicki, authorities say.

item.title: The Matrix film producer files for bankruptcy
item.description: Village Roadshow blames its troubles on a fall-out with Warner Bros and a failed move into independent film production.
